Module roborally
Package game.round

Class BoardElements

java.lang.Object
game.round.BoardElements
public class BoardElements
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains the all the board elements and their functionality. The execution of board elements are handled in activation phase.
Author:
Amulya, Louis

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardElements

      public BoardElements​(ActivationPhase activationPhase)

  • Method Details

    • activateGear

      public void activateGear()
      Gears rotate robots resting on them 90 degrees in the direction of the arrows. Red gears rotate left, and green gears rotate right. PlayerTurning Protocol is sent to all players.

    • activatePushPanel

      public void activatePushPanel()
      Push panels push any robots resting on them into the next space in the direction the push panel faces. They activate only in the register that corresponds to the number on them. For example, if the robot end register two on a push panel labeled “2, 4” you will be pushed. If the robot end register three on the same push panel, you won’t be pushed. Movement Protocol is sent to the players.

    • activateEnergySpace

      public void activateEnergySpace()
      Whenever the player finds in this tile, player gets the energy token. EnergyProtocol is sent to the player.

    • activateBlueBelts

      public void activateBlueBelts()
      When a player is on a blue belt at the end of a register, he gets moved 2 tiles in direction of the belt

    • activateGreenBelts

      public void activateGreenBelts()
      When a player is on a green belt at the end of a register, he gets moved 1 tile in direction of the belt

    • handleBeltMovement

      public void handleBeltMovement​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> playersOnBelt, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Boolean> actionFinished, java.util.ArrayList<Orientation> orientations, java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> oldPositions)
      Method that gets used to handle belt movement. Includes the functionality to move all players in a certain list into certain directions.
      Parameters:
      playersOnBelt - all players that are currently located on a belt.
      actionFinished - list that yields information about what players were already moved.
      orientations - Directions of player movements
      oldPositions - actual positions of the players. Later used to check whether player was moved or not

    • calculateNew

      public Coordinate calculateNew​(Player player, Orientation o)
      Calculates new coordinate if player moves one tile into a given direction
      Parameters:
      player - Player that the coordinate should be calculated for
      o - Direction player gets moved to

    • rotateOnBelt

      public void rotateOnBelt​(Robot robot, Orientation[] o)
      Implements rotating behavior of players when they enter a rotating belt.
      Parameters:
      robot - robot that gets rotated
      o - Orientations attribute of rotating belt
